head.citation-title: Bidimensional empirical mode decomposition and developed 2d Hilbert spectrum characters for the segmentation of texture
head.abstracts: We propose a novel texture segmentation method based on the Bidimensional empirical mode decomposition of image and 2D Hilbert spectrum characters of image. Bidimensional Empirical Mode Decomposition is a new proposed adaptive image decomposition method. Image can be decomposed to several mono-components, called Intrinsic Mode Function (IMF). Then we develop a new 2D Hilbert spectrum characters extraction method by quaternion analytic method. The Quaternionic analytic signal is a suitable analytic method for two dimensional analytic signals. A new polar form is further proposed to modulate images, and then seven 2D Hilbert spectrum characters are derived including instantaneous amplitude and instantaneous frequencies. These characters reflect the intrinsic characters of the image. The performance of this texture segmentation result further verifies the usefulness of these characters.

source.sourcetitle: Advances in Information Sciences and Service Sciences
